words.def: formerly the restricted quarter of many European cities in which Jews were required to live

used of physical heat

A letter capital Ð, small ð introduced into Old English to represent its dental fricative, then not distinguished from the letter thorn, no longer used in English but still in modern use in Icelandic, Faroese, and phonetics to represent the voiced dental fricative "th" sound as in the English word then.
two-year-old sheep
a return on a shot that seemed impossible to reach and would normally have resulted in a point for the opponent
an inflated feeling of pride in your superiority to others

one of the digits of the foot
a small amount (especially of a drink)

a very light colorless element that is one of the six inert gasses
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
Of bad quality.
